title: Drawing, "Design for Lobby, Possibly the Ante Room to the Music Room", 1815–22
medium: Watercolor, pen and ink on paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description:
Vertical rectangle. Design for the Royal Pavilion, Brighton. Perspective view of the end of a corridor, with a doorway on the wall facing the spectator, a section of another doorway at left, a long window at right. The wall covering: a bamboo in a geometric pattern. A marbleized dado; trellis design on cove of ceiling.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Lobby, Possibly the Ante Room to the Music Room", 1815–22.
1815–22. Watercolor, pen and ink on paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1948-40-55.
